fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is an option called watchers when you click on the ellipses(*...*) button in the issue navigation (when in list view):
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-12 at 14.07.22.png|thumbnail! 

But, when you are redirected to the to the watchers page, there is only one option to start watching or watch the issue even though you have permissions to manager watchers:
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-12 at 14.07.31.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Perform a search;
* Switch to *List view*;
* Click on the ellipses button when hovering over an issue -> *Watchers*.

h3. Expected Results

You will see all the options to manage watchers, as well as the list of watchers from the issue.

Pretty much like in the issue view:
!Screen Shot 2020-03-12 at 14.07.57.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

You will only see the option to start watching the issue, or stop watching it.

h3. Workaround

Access the issue in full view, and manage the watchers there.
fields.summary: Watchers option in issue navigation list view won't allow to add or see watchers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is desirable to have a Gantt Chart as an included feature in Jira to visualize issues and track their progress.
h3. Actual Results
The feature is not implemented and only there are some external plugins available that have this feature. It would be great to have it inbuilt. 

h3. Workaround
There are some external plugins available that have this feature.
Jira has the Roadmap feature available for Next-Gen.
fields.summary: Implement Gantt Chart

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The GIPHY is not showing up on the Activity Stream gadget of the dashboards
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert any GIPHY to an issue
 # Go to the Dashboard where the Activity Stream gadget is configured and it will show all GIPHY added as *Unable to embed resource*

h3. Expected Results

Show GIPHY added to the issue correctly
h3. Actual Results
!image-2020-03-09-17-04-39-387.png|width=601,height=87!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: GIPHY is not showing on the Activity Stream gadget from Dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when hovering the users name in JIRA Issues at Reporter or Assignee field, a profile pop up card will display. As of now, it only display the users name, title and organisations. It's best to have option to add more information, for example "Department" field

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to add more user profile information in the profile pop up card , for example "Department" field.

h3. Why this is important
Easy access for users to view the information from JIRA issues.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Allow to add Atlassian Account information in the User Profile Pop up in JIRA issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Userz would like to add User Profile Attributes from Identify Platform display at the User Profile at People page

h3. Suggested Solution
Expose User Attributes from Identity Platform at User Profile in People page.

h3. Why this is important
Users able to view all the information from their profile in JIRA
 
h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Allow to add User Attributes from Identity Platform to JIRA User Profile at People page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there are no options to track issue when "Customer Request Type" being updated.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide "WAS" JQL operator for "Customer Request Type" field 

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to use "WAS" JQL operation for "Customer Request Type" field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we add 'Field required' validator on a Workflow , for attachment validation, it does not work without the transition screen configuration for that transition.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a validator called Field required validator -> select 'Attachment' field for any of the transition in a workflow. For example from 'InProgress' to 'Done'.
 # Save this validator and publish the workflow.
 *Note: Do not add any transition screen for this Transition*.

h3. Expected Results
 * If Attachment is not added during the transition it should return error, and when attachment is added before the transition it should successfully transition.

h3. Actual Results
 * Even after adding the attachment , the error keeps popping up 'Transition failed: <error message>"

h3. Workaround
 * Workaround is to add a transition screen, for this transition, and then add "Attachment" field to it.
 Also , could not find any documentation that states we need to add the fields to transition screen in order for the validator to work. Official documentation does not mention about this either.
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/advanced-workflow-configuration-776636620.html#Advancedworkflowconfiguration-validators]
fields.summary: Adding a 'field required' Validator for Attachment on Workflow does not work without Transitions screen

fields.description:
At this time, to access the 'list view' of issues in a project, you must select the project > 'Issues and filters' > 'All issues'/'Open issues' > 'Advanced search' > and are then given the option to see 'Detail view' OR 'List view'.

 

Please create a more prominent option to view issues in this format.
fields.summary: Option to switch to 'List view' more easily on issues tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a notification email is sent about a comment containing an in-line image is opened in the desktop version of Outlook, the image is cropped and only the bottom part of it is loaded.
Note that:
* this issue only occurs with the Windows Desktop version of Outlook and not the web version of Outlook.
* this issue only occurs for requestors who only use email and don't use the portal who would then only see part of the image.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the Windows Desktop version of Outlook. 
 # Trigger an email notification with a thumbnail attachment, then another email with a full image attachment
Open the email notification in Outlook.


h3. Expected Results
The image from the comment is cropped and only the bottom part is loaded:
h3. Actual Results
The full image from the comment should be loaded, like it's the case on the web version of Outlook.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

This bug is similar to what is noticed in Jira server: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67468
fields.summary: Image is cropped (almost the whole part) when opening email notification in Outlook

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When viewing issues in GIN (the list view), there is a Max-width: 1280px parameter set on the "issue-container issue-container--bento" class which prevents the issue to be correctly resized, when the window size is less then 1280 horizontal pixels.

 !Screen Shot 2020-03-11 at 10.18.13.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screen Shot 2020-03-11 at 10.17.21.png|thumbnail! 

Since according to our [supported browser|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/supported-browsers-744721663.html] documentation states that the minimum resolution for Atlassian Cloud products to work is 1024x768, this is considered a bug.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access any filter on your Jira's Cloud instance;
# On your right corner, select the *detail view*. Copy the URL (https://cloud.atlassian.net/browse/KEY-1?filter=10000 for example);
# Switch the view to *list view*. Notice that the URL changes (https://cloud.atlassian.net/browse/?filter=10000 for example);
# Paste the URL from the *detail view* on your browser (https://cloud.atlassian.net/browse/KEY-1?filter=10000).
#* *This bug is not always reproducible!*

h3. Expected Results
The window is correctly resized when for less than 1280 horizontal pixels.

h3. Actual Results
The window get stuck with no less than 1280 horizontal pixels, creating an inconvenient horizontal scrollbar on the issue view.

h3. Workaround
Return to the *detail view* on the list view or access the issue directly (https://cloud.atlassian.net/browse/KEY-1)
fields.summary: When viewing issues in GIN, there is a Max-width 1280px parameter set which prevents the window to be correctly resized

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if a user re-assigns an issue, they are not added automatically added to the watcher's list.  The "Watch my issue" is defined with "If you select enabled, you will
automatically 'watch' the issues you interact with." This does not include re-assigning.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to configure how Watch my issue will function in terms of adding the user to the watcher's list. For example, having a list of interaction for users to select that will determine what type of interaction will automatically add them as a watcher.
fields.summary: Ability to configure how 'Watch my issue' works

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
# Currently, to create a Project from REST API, we will need to provide projectTemplateKey as per the example from 
{noformat}
{
    "key": "EX",
    "name": "Example",
    "projectTypeKey": "business",
    "projectTemplateKey": "com.atlassian.jira-core-project-templates:jira-core-project-management",
    "description": "Example Project description",
    "lead": "Charlie",
    "url": "http://<bas_ulr>.atlassian.net",
    "assigneeType": "PROJECT_LEAD",
    "avatarId": 10200,
    "issueSecurityScheme": 10001,
    "permissionScheme": 10011,
    "notificationScheme": 10021,
    "categoryId": 10120
}
{noformat}
# However, there is no REST API endpoint to retrieve the available {{projectTemplateKey}} from JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution
To have a REST API endpoint for us to retrieve the available {{projectTemplateKey}} from JIRA so that we can use the {{projectTemplateKey}} during the Project creation.
 
h3. Workaround 
The available {{projectTemplateKey}} is listed in Jira cloud Doc.
fields.summary: Provide REST API endpoint to retrieve projectTemplateKey

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can access the notifications panel in the new navigation by clicking on the bell icon, where you will see actions other users performed on the issues you are participating, or watching:
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-10 at 15.17.21.png|thumbnail! 

Currently, clicking on a comment notification will open the issue in the old view. 

See the recording:  [^Comment notification in new navigation.mp4] 


h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Have someone else comment on an issue that you are watching (or impersonate and user's account);
* Click on the notification icon while logged in with your main account, and follow the notification.

h3. Expected Results

Issue will be opened in the view you have opted to use.

h3. Actual Results

The issue will be opened in the old issue view.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: New navigation's Comment notification will redirect user to old view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you look for a custom field or status in JQL, Jira shows duplicated the fields but there is no clue to identify which project belongs to. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a custom field with the same name in Next-Gen Project and classic
 # Go to the Advanced search page and try to filter by this custom field
 # The custom field appears two times, which is good but there is not a description to identify which is the project it belongs to.
 # Same thing for statuses.  

h3. Expected Results

Display the project it belongs to. 

Or

Display the custom field/status description.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing is displayed:

!image-2020-03-10-11-00-12-358.png|width=912,height=246!
h3. Workaround

Quote the name and specify the project in the JQL sentence. 

!image-2020-03-10-10-59-07-761.png|width=1373,height=221!
fields.summary: Duplicated Field names in JQL Search

fields.description:
At the moment, there isn't a way for us to hide the field created by add-ons for instance Automation for Jira as this field is generated by the add-ons by default and doesn't exist from the screen. It would be nice to have a feature for us to turn off/hide the field from the issue  view. 

h4.Current behavior

The field is displayed from the issue view and no option for us to hide it from users. 
 !image-2020-03-10-21-03-20-059.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Suggestion
Provide the ability to hide Automation for Jira field from Jira.
fields.summary: Ability to hide Automation for Jira field from the issue view.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a filter result gadget is created, the gadget will be pinned on the dashboard and created with the default 'Filter Results:<filter-name>' name.

When attempting to rename the gadget, the text field only shows 'Filter Results' and not the filter name and cancelling the rename will just switch the name to 'Filter Results' (without the filter name) despite rename being cancelled. Refreshing the page however will fix this so this is mostly visual.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 !bandicam 2020-03-10 18-20-57-450.mp4! 

h3. Actual Results

Only the 'Filter Results' is shown during initial rename attempt. Also cancelling the rename do not revert the gadget name to the original name.

h3. Expected Results

The full gadget name should be shown during initial rename attempt. Cancellation of rename attempt should also revert gadget name to the original name.


h3. Workaround

Bug is visual. So just refresh the page.
fields.summary: Rename of filter result gadget is not working correctl.y

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The [New Jira Cloud navigation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/new-jira-cloud-navigation-983502691.html] has taken up 56px of vertical screen space across all Jira Cloud products and has reduced the amount of space for viewing issues on the Backlog, and Board (Active sprints or Kanban). Described as:
{quote}This is a developer’s most used view. I love the issue sidebar because it makes effective use of screen space, allowing me to see issue details without leaving the board. I wish the navigation followed this convention.
{quote}
h3. Suggested Solution

We have already received some feedback and interest in addressing this problem from multiple comments gathered in the feedback channel. This request is being created to collect feedback on what areas in Jira require more screen real estate to help users get their work done more efficiently.
fields.summary: Address loss of vertical space in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
The current author for the Jira issue will not know what changes are being done until the current author refreshes the page. This might cause a duplicate response/comment and redundant work. 

h3. Suggestion
Pop-up notification for changes on current the issue view.
fields.summary: Notify author if the current Jira issue has been updated by others

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The assignee Icon from issue disappears from the board when closing the issue popup screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enter main project jobs board.
# Click on an Issue to view it.
# Click top right corner "X" to close the issue dialogue box.
# Icon for assignee disappears from the board.

h3. Expected Results

Icon from the assignee must be kept on the issue board after closing the issue popup screen
h3. Actual Results

Icon from the assignee disappears

h3. Workaround

Refresh the browser and the Icons will appear again
fields.summary: Assignee Icon from issue disappears from board when closing the issue popup screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the Multi-user custom fields doesn't show profile card on hover
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Multi-user field or use a field such as "Request Participant" (Service Desk field)
 # Hover on the field

h3. Expected Results

The Profile card should pop out
h3. Actual Results

Nothing pops out.

h3. Workaround

Using the Old Issue view seems to work here.
fields.summary: Multi user custom fields doesn't show profile card on hover
Clearing out a custom field values still reports as NOT EMPTY in JQL search

fields.description:
Recently, there was the addition of two export buttons on the "Issue Navigator" page. The options were:
* Opening in Microsoft Excel
* Opening in Google Sheets


This feature is to track the progress of the moving process of these two buttons to the Export dropdown.
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-09 at 11.44.37.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Move export buttons (Excel and Google Sheets) to the Export dropdown

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the "Your work" page under the "Worked on tab", users can still see the issues they've worked on previously although they don't have access to it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a user to a group A
 # Grant group A to view project A
 # Get the user to create a test issue, comment on issue edit to fill in the "Worked on" page
 # Remove the user from group A
 # Try to access project A, you won't be able to.
 # But when the user visits "Your work" page, under the "Worked on" tab, the user can still see the issue summary 

h3. Expected Results

Users should not be able to see any information regarding issues for projects they do not have access to.
h3. Actual Results

Users can actually see the Issue summary, issue type. etc 
 But they cannot access it if they click on the issue
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Able to see issues in "Your work" page although permission is not granted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Road Map gadget doesn't return issues for versions that have issues

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with name PROJECT and key PRJ
 # Create a project with name PRJ and key PR
# Create versions and issues on both projects

h3. Expected Results
The gadget will list issues for both projects.

h3. Actual Results
The project that is using the other project's key as its name won't have issues listed on gadget.

h3. Workaround
Update the project name. It shouldn't be equals to the existing project keys
fields.summary: Jira Road Map gadget doesn't return issues for versions that have issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding a post function to set the issue security level on the creating transition, it's not working as expected
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project role
 # Create an Issue Security Level and add the current assignee to it
 # Associate that security level with a project
 # Add a post function to set the security level after the ticket is created.

h3. Expected Results
After the ticket is created, the security level supposed to be set. 
h3. Actual Results
After the ticket is created, none security level is set.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding a post function to set the security level on the create transition is not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the business project, if we search for issues with usernames in the search text boxes and then open issues in the pop-up window and close, the issue will disappear from the board.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a business project and go to the board
# Search the issue with a user name 
# open the issue in the pop-up window and then close the pop-up window
# the issue will disappear from the board

If we refresh the whole page the issue will reappear

The issue is specific to business projects only and can be replicated in our test instance as well.

This works well with a software project and no issue found.

h3. Expected Results

After closing the pop-up window, the issue should be visible on the board itself

h3. Actual Results

After closing the pop-up window, the issue disappears from the board.


h3. Workaround

The only workaround to view the issue again is to refresh the whole page again on the business project board.
fields.summary: On business project, if we search issues with username in search text box and then open issue in pop up window and close, the issue will disappear from the board.

fields.description:
マウスの操作を減らし、入力操作の時間を減らしたい

①ストーリーポイント（見積もり値）の入力を件名入力で、入力できるようにしてほしい

　例）入力：(8)XXとしてYYしたい

　　　結果：件名＝XXとしてYYしたい

　　　　　　ストーリーポイント＝8

②ショートカットキーにて作業納期の入力カーソルをアクティブになるようにしてほしい
fields.summary: キーボード入力での機能拡張

fields.description:
*Description*
Customer requests that, while creating a JQL, a query for reporting purposes, they do not see the field completely visible. It just shows as 'Due' and the 'date' text is missing.

*Customer Expectation*
"This impacts me because I create reports for executives and the field name 'due' in the report is not informative at all."

*Solution Expected*
Customer needs that the text "DATE" is in "DUE" field, so as it is "DUE DATE".
fields.summary: "Due" field misses the "date" text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the period Hot Key "." or the comma "," hot key from the View issue screen on the new issue view will open the site search dialogue box but no longer opens  the issue operations/actions search dialogue See BUG [JRACLOUD-71936|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71936] as referance where both actions will open the quick field editing in classic view currently, but only the period "." hot key works in the New Issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# From classic View press the period key "." or comma key "," while viewing an issue
# the behavior in JRACLOUD-71936 occurs
# Enable new issue view
# go back to same issue and repeat the same actions

h3. Expected Results
* The period (.) triggers Quick Operations
* The comma (,) triggers Quick field editingOptions
Issue Operations dialogue appears with options to: Edit Fields, Edit Issue, assign, comment, etc....
!Screen Shot 2020-03-06 at 11.21.43 AM.png|thumbnail! OR !Screen Shot 2020-03-06 at 11.26.35 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The period (.) triggers the Quick operations Actions Dialogue 
The Comma (,) does nothing

h3. Workaround
Note the workaround will still encounter BUG JRACLOUD-71936 but if you wish to regain access to the Quick Issue actions dialogue Disable the new issue view and use the Classic View Noting that Next-Gen projects cannot disable the new issue view:
 *Select User Avatar >> Personal Settings*  under the section "Jira labs"  Deselect the aria-lable selector checkbox for "New Jira issue view"
fields.summary: Using hot keys period "." OR comma "," on new issue view opens site search rather than issue actions

fields.description:
Currently, non-jira users have no possible way to be able to add a comment to a case via mail handler since the create comment issue permission will block them from doing so. Till the feature is in place, at least they should get a notification email informing them about lack of permissions and that the issue is not updated.

A feature would really help!
fields.summary: Non-jira user should be able to add a comment to a ticket via mail handler

fields.description:
Hello, from searches I made on community... Seems normal to impeed the LINKING from EPICS.

IF this is WAD, maybe it would be better to hide LINK ISSUE button when this option is not possible.
fields.summary: LINK issue button not working on EPIC

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If two issues are created on the same date and have the same number of comments, one issue (bubble) overlaps other and only one issue is shown in the gadget.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two issues TEST-1 and TEST-2 in a project TEST
# Add the same number of comments to both the issues (for example, 3 comments)
# Now create a filter for the project TEST and the filter results should include both the above issues created.
# In a dashboard, add *Bubble chart* gadget > Add the above filter > Save
# Gadget shows only the issue TEST-1 and can't see TEST-2 on the gadget

h3. Expected Results
Both the issues (created on the same day and having the same number of comments) should be shown on the gadget/bubble chart.

h3. Actual Results
One issue overlaps the other and the second issue is not visible on the chart

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Bubble gadget not displaying issues having same number of comments and created on the same day

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

From the *System Settings*, despite the _Product Recommendation_ turned _*OFF*_ it still shows the recommendation for trying out Jira Service Desk and/or Opsgenie.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Jira Settings > System > General Configuration
 # The Product Recommendation is OFF with no way to edit it.

h3. Expected Results

Customers will expect to edit this setting so no advertisement for other products should be seen by the uses. 
h3. Actual Results

The settings option, that can't be edited, remains and doesn't affect anything in the product.
h3. Workaround

Opt out of product suggestions, by browsing to the following link within your site administration

[https://admin.atlassian.com/s/<site-id>/billing/addapplication?requestproductoptout=false|https://admin.atlassian.com/s/a7d30d89-fe73-43e9-91b7-62798d670e02/billing/addapplication?requestproductoptout=false]
fields.summary: Turning the Product recommendations OFF has no visible effect

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
When a JQL with a specific word(s) is used and include into a Webhook listener, the webhook will push any comment being instead of notifying that specific word from JQL

h3. Suggestion
Allow Comment notification to be triggered through Webhook for specific comment that is defined through JQL
fields.summary: Allow webhook to push specific comment when a word is specified

fields.description:
Right now if I click into a code-formatted text box (like in a ticket description or comment) then hit a select-all shortcut (like Cmd+A for Mac or Ctrl+A for Windows), it selects everything on the page...

Typically in other interfaces, when I do this, it just selects the contents of the specialized box I'm in (like a code or quote formatted section).

When people leave a lot of text in one of these specially-formatted boxes (whatever they're called), it can be a pain trying to select all the content.
fields.summary: Select all in code box should only select its contents

fields.description: Currently, it is possible to change the status, leave a comment, etc. on an issue from the filter view, but it isn't possible to change other fields (e.g., *Labels*). It would be nice to be able to do this.
fields.summary: Ability to modify fields like Labels when viewing issues in a filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a business project when clicking on an issue in the board the pop-up view is displayed, when clicking back outside the assignee disappears, however, it disappears just in that view so if you refresh the page or if you enter into the issue the assignee is kept.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a business project, create an issue and assign it to a user
 # In the board click on the issue so the pop-up screen vie is shown
 # Click outside the screen 
 [^Assignee on board Business project BUG.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
The issues should remain without changes

h3. Actual Results
The assignee disappears

h3. Workaround
If the page is refreshed all returns to normal
fields.summary: In Business projects, the assignee disappears from the board in the pop-up screen

fields.description: When selecting a project in a JQL query, it would be a good functionality to only display the fields added to the field configuration of that project. This would avoid non-related fields to be displayed as suggestions when completing the JQL query.
fields.summary: Only Display fields added in the field configuration when selecting projects in JQL queries

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Moving issues with issue security level set to a next-gen project make the issue inaccessible

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Associate an issue security scheme to a classic project
# Set a security level to an issue
# Move the issue to a next-gen project

h3. Expected Results

The security level is cleared and the issue is visible in the new project

h3. Actual Results

The security level value remains in the issue records and the issue is inaccessible via UI

h3. Workaround

Please contact the Atlassian support to fix the issue security level record
fields.summary: Moving issues with issue security level set to a next-gen project make the issue inaccessible

fields.description:
Clicking on the code snippet icon (in the formatting toolbar) creates a new code snippet, but it's not yet possible to select existing text and apply the code formatting.

The icon simply creates a new snippet, requiring you to cut and paste the existing text into the code block.
fields.summary: Apply code formatting to selected text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A few days ago BCLOUD-19617 and JRACLOUD-67311 have been marked as fixed and, therefore, it should now be possible to export Bitbucket issues to JSON and import them into Jira with no need of editing the JSON. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export issues from Bitbucket to JSON: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/export-or-import-issue-data-330797432.html
 # Import the JSON into Jira Cloud: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-json-776636779.html

h3. Expected Results

It should fail unless you modify the JSON as documented in:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-bitbucket-935384618.html

h3. Actual Results
Since JRACLOUD-67311 and BCLOUD-19617 this should now work OOB

h3. Workaround
Do not modify the JSON, just follow the steps in:
- [Export issue data to Jira Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/export-issue-data-to-jira-cloud-993930294.html]
fields.summary: Now that JRACLOUD-67311 and BCLOUD-19617 have been addressed we need to update the documentation

fields.description:
*As a* JIRA user
*I want to* highlight flagged issues in epics
*so that* I can easily see which issues in an epic are flagged.

The "Issues in Epic" section doesn't currently highlight flagged issues: this ticket proposes highlighting them in yellow, like on boards.
fields.summary: Highlight flagged issues in Epics

fields.description:
h3.Summary
If a user mentions another user and mentioned user select the link received in the notification to view the comment on the issue the Classic issue view will be displayed rather than the new issue view 

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# user A mentions user B in comment 
# User B has the new issue view enabled
# User B selects link in the email received from notification
# The URL contains the comment ID redirect to set focus on the comment

h3.Expected Results
Issue loads new issue view EXE:
!Screen Shot 2020-03-04 at 4.27.27 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3.Actual Results
The Classic view is loaded rather than the users defined settings and Notice that the URL appends the following to the set focus on the comment user B was mentioned in:
{code}
?focusedCommentId=#####&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-#####
{code}
EXE: !Screen Shot 2020-03-04 at 4.31.22 PM.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
Click on the issues Bread crumb issue key at the top of the page or manually delete the additional section in the issue URL for the set focus values and refresh to load the correct issue view
!Screen Shot 2020-03-04 at 4.25.03 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: New issue View broken fails to load viewing a link from mention notification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Subtasks can be created in the new issue view when using the status property "jira.issue.editable"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the Workflow Editor ("Administration -> Projects -> <SELECTED-PROJECT> -> Workflow -> Edit)
# Add the following Workflow Property to one of the steps: 
* {{jira.issue.editable}} and set to {{false}}
# Publish the edited workflow
# Create a new issue for <SELECTED-PROJECT> and transition to the edited status
# Attempt to create a new "Sub-task" for the issue


h3. Expected Results

The create sub-task button does nothing or it is grayed out

h3. Actual Results

The sub-tasks are created without problems

h3. Workaround

Considering this problem affects only the new issue view, users can disable the new issue view as a workaround. To do this, please follow the steps described below:

# Click your user avatar at the bottom-left corner of the screen and click *Settings* (Under JIRA)
# Click the switch button next to *New Jira issue view* (under *Jira labs*)
fields.summary: Subtasks can be created in the new issue view when using the status property "jira.issue.editable"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to access an issue with too many worklogs, if the worklog tab is select, the issue won't load.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Open the worklog tab in an issue;
 # Try to access another issue with a high number of worklogs (~1000);

h3. Expected Results

The issue will load as expected;

h3. Actual Results

A timeout will happen and the issue won't load.

h3. Workaround

Access the new issue view as the worklogs are paginated.
fields.summary: Issues with too many worklog entries do not load as expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The wallboard does not display "Show the count as" icon selected in the "Build custom count" option within the *Filter Count gadget* in a dashboard.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a dashboard, add the *Filter Count gadget*
 # In the "Counts" section select "Build custom count"
 # Tick the "Show the count as" option !image-2020-03-04-19-00-47-644.png|thumbnail! 
 # Select "Caution" or any of the other options > Save.
 # On the dashboard, select "View as wallboard" option

h3. Expected Results
 Displays on the dashboard:  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
 Icons should display on wallboard as: !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
 Icons do not display on the wallboard:  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: The wallboard does not display "Show the count as" icon selected in the "Build custom count" option within the *Filter Count gadget* in a dashboard.

fields.description:
Dear Support,

 

we did integrate Jira and Githu by using free Github plugin [https://aanbod.move.nl/wonen/details/?searchermd5=9d9fe1ca8f8b9484f6b2e595d45d32b786f1c1c4&cmsdepartmentid=906511&searcherId=2010055&objectId=4643627&md5=0065cf60d7c8c5440fb1e947be740e37c5e6a63e] . It updates case when we do any commits at Github,  but not updating comment and time when we do it with commit.

So we have following questions:

1) In order to update comments and time from Github to Jira Cloud, do we need to use another app or it is just configuration we did is wrong?

2)To automatically match Jira issues and github commits - which app do we need to use?

 

Thanks,

Liena
fields.summary: Github and Jira integration

fields.description: Currently, in the mobile app, if we log time for an issue the default value that shows up is fixed and there is no way to change it. It is inconvenient to scroll the values every time to log a different time and hence there should be a way to either enter numeric values or set some default value.
fields.summary: In mobile, there should be a way to customise default value that shows up during log time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A secondary field like _job title_ can be provisioned from the IDP. However, when the user joins Jira for the first time, they are taken through a quick onboarding experience. The choices there will change the user's _job title_

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Provision a user to an organization. The _job title_ field will get its value from the IDP:
 !image-2020-02-11-13-39-10-672.png|thumbnail! 
 # When the user logs in for the first time in Jira, they are presented with a quick onboarding:
 !Onboarding_position.png|thumbnail! 
# Choosing any job titles here will overwrite whatever is provided by the IDP:
 !image-2020-02-11-13-41-17-114.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
Since the field is not editable in the org administration area by the org admin, it should remain set to whatever the IDP pushed.

h3. Actual Results

The field is editable by the user through the onboarding experience.

h3. Workaround
After the onboarding changed the field's value, performing a change in the IDP to trigger a re-sync will fix it back
fields.summary: Provisioned secondary field gets overwritten by the user onboarding experience

fields.description: We have noticed that, through the Jira integration tool in SF, it is automatically attaching attachments from the SF case to the Jira. In theory this would be a good idea, but on longer thread cases....
fields.summary: How to disable the sharing of attachments while case record share From Salesforce to Jira.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This is filed in Jira because it's most likely a problem with the gadget on Jira's side.
Creating a Created vs. Resolved chart in Confluence from a Jira Cloud site does not apply  cumulative totals when selected.

This issue is marked as Medium severity as it is a functional break in behaviour but is not used a lot.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a filter in Jira, name it "tiger"
# go to the associated confluence tenant and add a gadget to a page
# select the "Created vs Resolved" chart
# search for and find the "tiger" filter
# set the "Cumulative Totals" setting to "Yes" (note that the UI is different from when adding a gadget on a Jira dashboard)
# save the gadger and view it in your confluence page

h3. Expected Results
The chart is displayed with cumulative totals

h3. Actual Results
The chart is displayed with events.

h3. Workaround
Create a dashboard in Jira and link to that.
fields.summary: Creating a Created vs. Resolved chart in Confluence from a Jira Cloud site does not apply  cumulative totals when selected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * The "Link Confluence" button can be removed if the "Linked Issues" permission is revoked on an instance that doesn't have Confluence, but the "Link Confluence" button is still displayed if the instance doesn't have Confluence installed
 * The button doesn't serve a purpose if Confluence is not added to an instance and should be made so admins can show/hide the button
* The behavior shown below only occurs when the Cloud instance has Confluence installed
||Without Link Issues permission||With Link Issues permission||
| !Screenshot 2020-03-03 at 10.33.13.png|thumbnail! | !Screenshot 2020-03-03 at 10.37.46.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure that the Confluence is not added to the test instance
 # Remove the "Link Issues" permission for the appropriate users
 # Access a random issue

h3. Expected Results
 * The "Link Confluence" button is no longer displayed

h3. Actual Results
 * The "Link Confluence" button is still displayed

h3. Workaround
 * Add Confluence to your instance: [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/pricing]
fields.summary: Removing "Link Issues" permission doesn't remove the "Link Confluence" button if the Cloud instance doesn't have Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User an external app (third-party software) to update issues using the API causes to a User Picker custom field to be cleared if using username or name.
instead of the field updating to the username, the field is updating to None or empty at the new issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
example of python code
  import jira
  from jira import JIRA
  dev_owner='{color:red}usernamei{color}'
  jira_id='JIRA-1234'

  auth_jira=JIRA(server='https://\{0}'.format(host\), basic_auth=\(login, password\)\)
  jira_task = auth_jira.issue(jira_id\)
  jira_task.update({color:red}customfield_11901{color}=\{'name': dev_owner}\)

*customfield_11901 is the user picker field that previously had a value
h3. Expected Results
The user picker field should keep the old value instead of trying to update using the username and clear the field. Also, there should be a validation to match the old username with the new AtlassianID to populate the field

h3. Actual Results
 !image-2020-03-03-14-55-59-767.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The code source should be updated to use the Atlassian ID. However, it would require from the customer side to map all the users and Users ID to be properly referenced.
fields.summary: Using an external app (third-party software) to update issues using the API causes to a User Picker custom field to be cleared if using username or name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the status name got renamed, all the filter queries using that particular status are getting broke.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Global Issue Navigator, and save a filter with the *name Filter1* with JQL as *status = Done*
2. Navigate to System > Issues > Status
3. Search for Done and rename it to done
4. Open the filter "Filter1"

h3. Expected Results
The system should automatically update the status in the JQL queries from the filters when the status is renamed.

h3. Actual Results
After renaming the workflow status, the filters gets break.
 !Screenshot 2020-03-03 at 8.06.09 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
1. Use status ID instead of the status name.
2. To fetch the status ID of the currently used status, run an API:

{quote}
InstanceURL/rest/api/3/status
{quote}
fields.summary: JQL filters break if the status name got renamed

fields.description:
It would be nice to have the ability to show more than just the summary, issue key, and project when using the quick search feature. This could be used to show other information that is needed at a glance rather than having to build a filter or click into the issues to view the data.

We open many issues with the same/similar summaries but different Tempo account custom fields for billing purposes. Logging time against these issues or finding them quickly is hard as it is nearly impossible to tell which issue belongs to which customer. Our current workaround is to use a naming scheme but it would be nice to show that field in the quick search results. 

!image-2020-03-03-09-18-55-333.png!
fields.summary: Show more fields in Quicksearch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When viewing the stories using the JIRA App on their Macs (in dark mode) the colour combinations make it almost impossible to read what is in those info panels

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use the Info panel in Jira Mac app Dark Mode to view the stories. 
 
h3. Expected Results
The colour combination should be user friendly and the text should be easy to read. 

h3. Actual Results
Very difficult to read. 

h3. Workaround
* Changing the colour of the text on the Info Panel - I've found red text works with most Info Panels for both Web Browsers and Jira Mac, bar the red warning (where I used green or blue).
* Use light mode, where the standard text colours still work for Info Panels.
* Headers, which do work on the Jira Mac App
* Separate Fields - for example, we have a separate field for Acceptance Criteria
fields.summary: Jira Mac App Dark Mode Info Panel Issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, using JQL in Issue Navigator will change "Reporter" or "Assignee" name to AAID when the name is selected from the drop-down list. It would be good to have better JQL UI experience in Issue Navigator.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to Issue Navigator and switch to JQL
# Type "reporter = " or "assignee = "
# List of users will be listed in the drop-down list
# Select one of the users

h3. Expected Results

JQL created would be:
{code}
reporter = <name>
{code}

h3. Actual Results

JQL created:
{code}
reporter = <AAID>
{code}

h3. Workaround

Click on "Switch to Basic", then click back on "Switch to JQL", the AAID will be changed to _name_.
fields.summary: Better JQL UI experience for customers in Issue Navigator when using "Reporter" or "Assignee"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Opening the issue in the sidebar, when the user hits ESC to close the attachment in the issue, it closes both the attachment preview and the sidebar. It should close just the attachment and close the issue sidebar only when pressing ESC again. This is just happening in the board view, not in the backlog.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure the issue to open in the sidebar
 # Add an attachment to an issue
 # Open the issue
 # Open the attachment
 # Press Esc to close the attachment
 # It will close the attachment and the issue

Video: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/E0uqnOek]
h3. Expected Results

When pressing Esc, just the attachment is closed.
h3. Actual Results

When pressing Esc, the attachment and the issue are closed.
h3. Workaround

Open the issue in dialog.
fields.summary: Pressing ESC to close the attachment in Sidebar view closes the issue too

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to add a gadget to a dashboard, the "Add a gadget" text truncate at the bottom.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the dashboard /secure/Dashboard.jspa
# Trying to add a new gadget using the "Add gadget" option from the top right.
# The text is truncated.

h3. Expected Results
The dialog display correctly.
h3. Actual Results
The text from "Add gadget" truncated. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Add Gadget Dialog truncate the text from bottom

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Officially, the "Account" field from the Tempo app doesn't work on team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects. We even have the following Feature Request asking for this to be implemented:

* [JRACLOUD-71325 - Ability to edit the Tempo Account field in NextGen projects|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71325]

However, up until recently, there was a workaround to set a value on this field for team-managed (formerly next-gen) issues. By bulk editing these issues, it was possible to set a value for this field.

Something changed in the last weeks where it is not possible to use this workaround any longer. This is affecting teams which use team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects and the Tempo app.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Perform a bulk edit on team-managed (formerly next-gen) issues

h3. Expected Results
The "Account" Tempo field is available to be set.

h3. Actual Results
The "Account" Tempo field no longer available.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Can't set the "Account" Tempo field for team-managed (formerly next-gen) issues on bulk edits any longer

fields.description:
h3.Summary

As suggested from the title, it will be nice if  the JIRA Service Desk organisation field is included in the list of groups/users when choosing who to send the notification to. 

Currently the only way to send notification to  the entire organisation is by adding all the users into a group and the specifying the group in the notification action.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Include organisation field values for 'Send notification' action in Automation for JIRA

fields.description:
When creating an issue from Slack, I need to select the Jira project to create the issue in.
 
I only have 1 Jira project, so this always feels a bit useless. (Selecting the project takes 2 clicks and some noticeable loading time.)
 
Would it be possible to auto-select the project if the user has only 1 Jira project? That would save me from having to do this manual step.
fields.summary: Slack: auto-select project if there’s only 1

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When linking issues in the new issue view the Done tasks are not displayed to be picked. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two issues and transition one to “Done”
 # Link the “*Open*” issue with the “*Done*” issue (here is when I’m unable to find the “DONE” issue)
 !image-2020-02-28-16-44-53-788.png!

h3. Expected Results

It is expected all issues are displayed even complete ones. 
h3. Actual Results

Jira excludes Done Issues in the searching box.
h3. Workaround

Use the Old issue View where this function works fine.
fields.summary: Linking Issues in new Issue View fails.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, the TTL of tokens inside a URL generated for the api.media.atlassian.com address is of 30 days.

h3. Suggested Solution
The TTL of the token should either be configurable or have a much short lifecycle, such as 24h.

h3. Why this is important
This can be seen as a security breach according to some companies security policies.

h3. Workaround 
At this moment, there is none.
fields.summary: Tokens generated for api.media.atlassian.com should have a shorter TTL

fields.description:
h3. Problem

In Jira Cloud, currently, there is no way to change the background color of a cell the same as Confluence.

There was a feature request closed as won't do, but it was related to Wiki Markup and not the new editor. 
h3. Suggestion

Add the same option as the editor in Confluence to change the cell background color.
fields.summary: Ability to change the cell background color when using the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating an issue with a video, the Description field cannot be edited in the New Issue View.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new issue in a project and add *ONLY* the video attachment during the issue creation.
 # Try to edit the Description Field

h3. Expected Results

It will be possible to edit the Description field.

h3. Actual Results

It is not possible to edit the Description field.

h3. Workaround

See the issue in the old issue view and either remove the attachment or add a character in the description.
fields.summary: When creating an issue with a video, the Description field cannot be edited in the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The gadget *Created vs. Resolved Chart* returns the error: "The Jira server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation". 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the account-preferences [here|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences] and change the timezone to *US/Pacific-New*.
 # Access any Dashboard and Create a gadget *Created vs. Resolved Chart* and configure it.
 
h3. Expected Results
The gadget would show reports properly.
h3. Actual Results
The gadget returns an error and does not display anything.

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...timezone not recognized
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Change the timezone to another one and the gadget will be displayed properly.
fields.summary: Gadget Created vs. Resolved with error

fields.description: As a user, I would like to customize the number of days to automatically archive issues in the Done column.
fields.summary: Customize done issues
JQL should refer to a readable user information
Ability to filter Activity Stream from Jira using Account ID

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Your work page in [New Jira Cloud navigation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/new-jira-cloud-navigation-983502691.html] is currently a static page without any customization options for the layout, or content,  Described as:
{quote}
Your work - Get an overview of the things you care most about in Jira. Find issues, projects, boards, and queues you've visited, work assigned to you, and your starred items.
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
We have already received some feedback and interest in improving this feature in the comments of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73180 and This request is being created to collect feedback on what customization functionality would be most useful to see in the "Your Work" page
fields.summary: Customization options for the the "Your Work" Page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When viewing an issue in Jira, there exists an Activity tab you can click on.  This shows all kinds of actions in relation to the issue such as comments, issues updates, mentions etc.  However at times when there is a lot of data to here, Jira will currently use a 'Read More' link so that it doesn't actually load the entire comment here.

 !jracloud-readmorelink.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Suggested Solution
If there was an option in Jira to allow either administrators or end users to prevent this read more link and instead show the entirety of the activity event in relation to that issue, this would be helpful in some use cases.

h3. Why this is important
Promotes more transparency in regards to data and changes within Jira

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: When viewing the activity tab of an issue you should be able to see the entire action, and not have to click a 'Read More' link to see the full comment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Public filter return private information like project name when using the /rest/api/3/filter/ from non-authenticated users
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a filter set to public
 # Run the api /rest/api/3/filter/

h3. Expected Results

It should behave like the UI where the filter owner is not displayed and the JQL removes the project information and change to project ID so no private information is returned for non-authenticated users
h3. Actual Results

The API returns information about the filter owner and if the JQL uses a project name, it includes the project name at the search.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Public filter return private information like project name when using the /rest/api/3/filter/  from non-authenticated users

fields.description:
At the moment, in order to create a new issue from a new tab, the user would need to click on the issue to open the issue from a new tab. After that, select on the "+" sign from the left sidebar to create a new issue. It would be beneficial if a "Create issue" option is added to the option when right-clicking on a ticket:

h4. Current Behavior
Open a new tab and then create an issue

h4. Suggestion
Add an option to create an issue which will open a new tab from the options,  

Note: Add an option here to create a new issue

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to create an issue from a new tab from the Sprint View.

fields.description: We would like to be notified when field changes.
fields.summary: Webhook on field changes

fields.description: We would like to be notified when filter changes
fields.summary: Webhook on filter add/update/remove

fields.description:
We would like to know if user permission changes.
Permissions to:
issue,
project,
fields.summary: Webhook on user permission change

fields.description: We would like to be notified on group changes.
fields.summary: Webhook on group change

fields.description:
h3. Get bulk permissions

POST /rest/api/3/permissions/check

This API is not providing the required bulk permission details. Is this API only specific to provide the bulk permission details only if user has admin privilege, or it provides the information for those user's who doesn't have the admin privilege permission also.  .
fields.summary: Not able to access the bulk permissions using Get bulk permissions API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the New Issue View, you can now change the issue type by clicking on the issue type icon, when choosing another issue type, the screen transitions to the Move action screen, in this screen the issue type that you chose defaults back to the original issue type of the issue before the change. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any issue in new issue view, ensure the issue type to be changed has a different workflow.
# Click on the issue type icon, let's say, the default issue type of the issue is "A", the chosen new issue type is "B", from the dropdown click on issue type "B"
!sampletest.png|thumbnail! 
# The screen transitions to the Move Issue wizard assistance, the newly chosen issue type "B" value from the previous stage is not carried over. You need to choose the issue type "B" again in this step. 
!project.PNG|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

When a new issue type is chosen in the new issue view screen, I expect the chosen option to carry over to the Move Issue Wizard screen, so I can click on "Next" straight away.

h3. Actual Results

When a new issue type is chosen in the new issue view screen, I need to choose the same new issue type again in the Move Issue Wizard screen, before moving forward.

h3. Exception
- If you choose an issue type with the same workflow in the New Issue View, the transition is smooth, the change made works as expected.
- If you choose "Sub-task" as the issue type option, the convert issue screen shows the chosen option correctly and works as expected. 


h3. Workaround

You need to choose the option again from the dropdown which adds an extra step.
fields.summary: When changing the issue type in New Issue View, the chosen option does not carry over to the Move Issue screen.

fields.description: It would be great if you could add a way to create new stories from the board view.
fields.summary: Ability to create new stories from board view in next-gen

fields.description: It would be good to have a new gadget that allows insertion of texts and attachments
fields.summary: Create a gadget that allows insertion of texts and attachments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Introduce the feature to view which users have access to a project.

h3. Suggested Solution
Feature to view which users have access to a project.

h3. Why this is important
Customers want to know which users have access to a project.
fields.summary: Introduce the feature to view which users have access to a project.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the create Rule in A4J, doesn't allow static issue key search

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Rule
 # Use an Action that creates a sub-task

h3. Expected Results
In the create sub-task action, you should be able to select a Parent task

h3. Actual Results
No option is shown when searching for a Parent task
 !image-20200129-010358.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Create issue sub-task parent link no longer allows static issue keys

fields.description:
Per [https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/marketplace/server-app-licensing/?_ga=2.261987657.577283555.1581961916-575750831.1580850133]

{quote}
Marketplace app customers can get developer licenses for apps just as
they can for host Atlassian products. Developer licenses are intended 
for staging or development environments only. Customers who have 
purchased Marketplace apps can get developer licenses by clicking the View Developer License link from their license page on my.atlassian.com
{quote}

When setting up a JIRA Cloud instance for Dev or Staging purposes, there is no equivalent way to get developer licenses. This means you have to get a new trial license every 30-days, and I assume that there is a limit for those at some point.

It would be great if it worked like Server, where:

{quote}
The license types between the app and host product must match. That is, an app with a developer license only works in a host product that also has a developer license.
{quote}

In two separate tickets, I was told by support that [Cloud development instances|https://blog.developer.atlassian.com/cloud-ecosystem-dev-env/] can be used for Dev/Staging clones of a production instance, and that I would not have to pay for those instances as long as I stayed below the usage limits (which is a whole 'other story.)

Anyways though, it's hard to have a proper Dev/Staging environment without add-ons, or having to worry about add-ons constantly expiring.
fields.summary: Need Developer Licenses for JIRA Cloud Addons

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the *Send email* action to a given address, the accountId of the user is displayed instead of the Display name when using the _{{issue.creator}}_ smart values in the Automation for Jira tool. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule like When: Issue created > Then: Send email
 # Include the "_{{issue.creator}}_" smart value in the email (content, subject or from name)
 # Trigger the rule by creating an Issue

h3. Expected Results

When triggered, assuming you have the *Browse users and groups* permission you should receive an email notification displaying the Display name of the user.

 !Issue_KFF-997_is_created.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The email is sent displaying the accountId instead.

 !Issue_KFF-995_is_created_accountid.png|thumbnail! 

When leaving the "From name" empty, the displayed name is *Automation for Jira*. Note that the issue here is that the _{{issue.creator}}_ smart value retrieves the acountId instead of the Display name.

h3. Workaround

There is no known workaround at this point in time.
fields.summary: Email notification action returns accountId instead of display name in emails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you mentioned an Issue on comments depending on the view, it appears as a URL or as a "Smart Link". 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Comment Issue in the new Issue View, i.g: PROJ-123
 # Go the Old issue view, it is just a normal Link
 # Browse the issue in the sidebar kanban board and it is a normal Link

h3. Expected Results

It is expected that a "Smart Link" is shown as in the new Issue View. 

Also, the normal quotation of issues with brackets should be supported in both views. 
h3. Actual Results
|!image-2020-02-25-10-21-12-065.png|thumbnail!|!image-2020-02-25-10-21-37-530.png|thumbnail!|!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!|
|New Issue View|Old Issue View|SideBar|
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Mention issues is not working well in all views

fields.description:
Currently, there is no notification triggered for mobile apps when an issue is created. It will be great if this could be enabled.
As a sample use case, a service desk agent would like to be able to receive notifications whenever a new request is created.

h4. Workaround
Set up an automation rule to alert a user when a request is created
fields.summary: Mobile app notification for issue creation

fields.description:
Similar to [this request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-69332] to allow the drag and drop of attachments to a Jira issue (in the new view) as it worked in the previous model, without any media picker enabled while editing the issue, the user can no longer drag and drop it outside of Jira in order to have the file downloaded.

For different use cases, dragging and dropping the file outside of Jira could help to directly put the file in a folder without necessarily needing to go through the download steps and then, selecting the necessary folder, which would add extra steps.

This is a suggestion to allow attached files to be dragged and dropped outside of Jira, as it worked in the legacy issue view.
fields.summary: New issue view - Allow drag and drop of attachments outside of Jira

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to manually enter time in *Date Time Picker* field as it currently only allows selecting 30 minute increments instead of allowing the ability to specify a more specific time.

At the very least, it would be nice if it could be broken down into 5 minute increments.
fields.summary: Ability to manually enter time in Date Time Picker field

fields.description:
h6. Summary

Request to change the current filename of the exported CSV file.
h6. Possible solution

Ability to change a CSV exported file name before the action.
fields.summary: Change filename of the CSV exported file

fields.description:
Previously, on the Old Issue View, when you click a linked issue, you're shown that issue on a modal window.

It'd be optimal to have linked issues to open on a modal when using the New Issue View as well.
fields.summary: Open Linked Issues on a modal instead of redirecting the currently open page to it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to view the issue types associated with a custom field's context
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a context for any of your custom fields.
 # If the configuration for this field is only applicable to a few issue types, the chosen issue types are *not* listed when viewing this configuration.
 !ConfiguringContext_SpecificIssueTypes.png! 
 !IssueTypesNotVisible.png!
 # However, if the configuration is applied for all issue types then under *Issue type(s)* you would see _Global (all issues)_
 !ConfiguringContext_GlobalIssueTypes.png!

h3. Expected Results

The issue types should be listed when viewing the configuration for the custom field.
h3. Actual Results

The issue types are not getting listed when viewing the configuration for the custom field.
h3. Workaround

To view the issue types configured within the custom field's context,
 # Please list all your custom fields by browsing to – https://<site-url>/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa
 # Click on the desired custom field, and then move to the tab *_Contexts_*.
 !Workaround.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Custom field's context configuration view does not list the configured issue types

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If an issue summary has a backspace character (Ctrl+H/^H), the activity stream fails to load this issue and shows *No activity was found* message.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with a summary having a backspace character (^H)
# Create a dashboard with *activity stream* gadget added and add a filter so that the above issue will be included in the filter results (for example, username is xxxxx in the filter)
# Activity stream fails to load

h3. Expected Results
The activity stream should display the result/issues with a backspace character.

h3. Actual Results
If the activity stream results include an issue with a backspace character, the gadget doesn't show any results.

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to remove the backspace character from the issue summary.
fields.summary: Activity stream doesn't load when a backspace character is used in issue summary

fields.description:
Issue -

1. Add Log work screen to the transition of a workflow
2. Trigger the transition on a sample issue
3. Log work screen will show up, kindly add a comment in it.
4. The comment will show up under the Worklog as well as the Comment tab of the issue.

Requirement -  When we directly track time on any issue and enter a comment, it is only added to the Worklog but if we do the same via transition, it gets added to the Comment tab as well.  There should be a way to keep the comment limited to the Worklog tab only.

Reason - There is a predefined post function in the workflow which can not be deleted :
{code}
Add a comment to an issue if one is entered during a transition.{code}

Here is the feature request for the same - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25070
fields.summary: Log work screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to install add-on's from marketplace. 
Error: "We ran into a little trouble It might just be a hiccup. Try again in a bit."
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to install add-on's from the Marketplace and it throws up the error 
"We ran into a little trouble It might just be a hiccup. Try again in a bit."

h3. Expected Results
Add-on should be installed. 

h3. Actual Results

"We ran into a little trouble It might just be a hiccup. Try again in a bit." 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to install add-on's from marketplace.

fields.description: In JIRA Cloud of Slack App, it would be interesting if you have a filter by the Board of Jira. In my work there are two teams and I do not want to see everyone's activities.
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud of Slack App - Filter by the Board of Jira

fields.description:
Could the structure of how the fields appear in the View Issue Screen be changed to:

Fields can only be dragged and placed to a new position, vertically, to avoid scrolling down, can the fields be enabled to be positioned beside each other i.e. horizontally?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Positioning of Fields to Change (from vertical to horizontal)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, XSRF tokens are not refreshed automatically and we have seen an increasing number of customers who are getting the error message *{{'XSRF security token missing'}}* multiple times in a day.

This is happening to them across multiple browsers and after full cache clearing or re-installation of the browser.

Most commonly this is happening when transitioning an issue status. 



h3. Steps to Reproduce
_NB. (only for affected users, intermittent issue.)_
 # Use Jira as normal.
 # Work on an issue. 
 # Try to transition the issue status. 

h3. Expected Results
The issue should transition as normal
h3. Actual Results
The following error is shown to the user:
 !image-2020-02-20-23-15-26-712.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior as a permanent fix. A workaround will be added here when available.

However, clearing your browser cache will reduce the time between XSRF tokens expiring
fields.summary: XSRF session token expiring frequently

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when searching for issues in the list view, it's only possible to see the exact time an issue was created or updated while hovering your mouse over those two fields or when directly accessing a ticket.

Without hovering the *Created* and *Updated* fields only shown the date respective to those changes.

We don't see the same behavior for other *Date Time fields* which are not default from JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution

Please change this behavior so the *Closed* and *Resolved* system fields present the date and time when seeing issues on the search page.
fields.summary: Display time value for created and updated fields when searching for issues
